dialogue: Nosebleeds. Is that common for you?

We’ll run blood tests to check for clotting abnormalities, blood cell problems, electrolyte imbalances and whatnot. Headaches. That’s expected, that’s the number one side effect. Essentially it means you’re taking the medicine. Diarrhea, also common, and you have IBS, it says here. Is it worse than usual?
Stay hydrated. Drink those yellow sports drinks. They taste good too. Your handwriting is like a doctor’s. Vivid dreams. Good dreams, I hope.
Ah. Bad dreams. Normal for you?

My poor daughter gets them. Has to sleep with me now. In my dreams I fly, I make love. Why should she suffer? Try listening to music in bed. The lute - that helps I hear. That particular timbre - maybe the lap steel or the lute, but I don’t know, look it up. What’s this...peculiar sense of taste?
I think, like, like chocolate. I had to spit it out.
You eat a lot of treats?

Well, cut the sweet stuff out for now. Really, you should phase it out entirely. You’re not a kid anymore, Mr. Lemuel. But I’m not your rabbi. Look, your body is adjusting to a boatload of new and potent - not to mention experimental - medication, and these are all fairly standard-issue side effects, so just bear with us. The risk is surely worth the reward, I would think.
